	To let me alone. (As she leaves the door.) 1 askcd you that,

B:
	Nay, nay,
There was reason enough for such a fear.
But thanks be to Heaven that fear is gone;

A:

B:

	[Spitefully.] It seems to me it's much more for Martha's sake,

	Get out! GET OUT!

	[_Modestly._] Mother, how'd it be if I was to open the window jus' a

A:
	I don't care. Don't speak to me again.

B:

A:
	Oh, love me always, Gertrude, love me always!

B:
	God knows I would sooner some one else did it! But none can do it
